com.mapbox.mapboxsdk

Class MapboxAccountManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.MapboxAccountManager

  • public class MapboxAccountManager
extends Object

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static MapboxAccountManager start(android.content.Context context,
                                         String accessToken)
        Primary entry point to Mapbox for implementing developers. Must be configured in either Application.onCreate() or Launch Activity.onCreate()
        Parameters:
        context - Context used to get Application Context
        accessToken - Mapbox Access Token. You can get one on the Mapbox Web site.
        Returns:
        MapboxAccountManager instance for app

      • getInstance

        public static MapboxAccountManager getInstance()
        Internal Use Only Get an instance of MapboxAccountManager configured with the app's Access Token
        Returns:
        MapboxAccountManager instance for app. May be NULL if not configured yet.

      • getAccessToken

        public String getAccessToken()
        Access Token for this application.
        Returns:
        Mapbox Access Token

      • validateAccessToken

        public static void validateAccessToken(String accessToken)
                                throws InvalidAccessTokenException
        Runtime validation of Access Token.
        Parameters:
        accessToken - Access Token to check
        Throws:
        InvalidAccessTokenException - the exception thrown

      • setConnected

        public void setConnected(Boolean connected)
        Manually sets the connectivity state of the app. This is useful for apps that control their own connectivity state and want to bypass any checks to the ConnectivityManager.
        Parameters:
        connected - flag to determine the connectivity state, true for connected, false for disconnected, null for ConnectivityManager to determine.

      • isConnected

        public Boolean isConnected()
        Determines whether we have an Internet connection available. Please do not rely on this method in your apps, this method is used internally by the SDK.
        Returns:
        true if there is an Internet connection, false otherwise

      • getApplicationContext

        public android.content.Context getApplicationContext()
        Not public API
        Returns:
        the Application Context
